newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: No major food aid for N.Korea without peace-Cohen.
newsitem.headline: No major food aid for N.Korea without peace-Cohen.

text.p: U.S. Defence Secretary William Cohen said on Friday that large-scale food aid to North Korea was highly unlikely until Pyongyang began dismantling its powerful military machine threatening the South.
At a news conference before leaving South Korea, Cohen bluntly warned Pyongyang that any aggression would be suicidal, resulting in "overwhelming damage and defeat" for the Stalinist state.
"I doubt very much whether there will be massive assistance without some kind of reciprocal action on the part of the North Koreans," he said.
"It would be unreasonable to expect the world community to subsidise and to support a domestic economy that is in a state of collapse while the military continues to operate at ordinary rates."
Cohen expressed doubts about Pyongyang's sincerity in appealing for aid.

"There is still scepticism as to whether or not North Korea is prepared to pursue a path of peace as opposed to simply trying to procure additional food to keep its citizenry fed while its military continues to function and to soak up what limited resources they have."
